title.native: ダンガンロンパ３ –The End of 希望ヶ峰学園– 未来編
title.romaji: Danganronpa 3: The End of Kibougamine Gakuen - Mirai-hen
title.english: Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope’s Peak High School - Future Arc

description:
Makoto Naegi, the Ultimate Hope who defeated the Ultimate Despair, Junko Enoshima, is under suspicion of treason against the Future Foundation for harboring the Remnants of Despair who carried on her will. As top members of the Future Foundation, including Makoto's former classmates Kyoko Kirigiri, Aoi Asahina, and Yasuhiro Hagakure, are brought together to decide on Makoto's punishment, they are all imprisoned by Monokuma, who forces everyone to participate in a final killing game. They must try to find the traitor among them who will kill them in their sleep, while also trying to avoid being mortally poisoned by personalised forbidden actions. Thrust into a game where no one can trust each other, Makoto's ideals of hope are pushed to their very limits.

(Source: IMDB, edited)

Aired alongside of Danganronpa 3: Zetsubou-hen, with Mirai-hen starting first.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

node.description:
Rui Komatsuzaki is best known as the main concept artist of the Danganronpa franchise.

Komatsuzaki was a sculpture graduate before becoming involved with Spike, and Danganronpa was his first experience as a character designer.

(Source: Danganronpa Wiki)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kazkodaka/)

A former employee of Spike Chunsoft and the co-founder of Too Kyo Games. He is primarily known for being the creator and scenario writer of the _Danganronpa_ video game series.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/995498317)

Interested in films and comics from his early childhood on. After graduating high school he went to Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and afterwards started working as animator for [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/). After becoming a freelancer for a short time, he joined Logistics where he worked in the software development section and was responsible for animation work and later developing tools for animation work in games. In 2002 he founded [Team Till Dawn](https://anilist.co/studio/6412/), which was also the beginning of his career as anime director.

His hobbies outside of work include bodybuilding, in which he has gone as far as to take part in competitions

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/93473950)

Worked as an assistant to [Shirou Oono](https://anilist.co/staff/132305/) in the late '90s.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/daiki_fukuoka)

**Daiki Fukuoka** is a Japanese director, episode director, production manager and storyboard artist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/KoudenMS)

Masafumi Takada is a japanese composer and sound designer best known for his work on the soundtracks for killer7, God Hand, No More Heroes, and the Earth Defense Force and the Danganronpa series.

[Profile](http://nbcuni-music.com/maon/profile/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kurosakimaon) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/kurosakimaon) | [Youtube](http://www.youtube.com/user/maongue) 

Maon Kurosaki was a Japanese singer and songwriter signed to NBCUniversal Entertainment Japan. After being discovered while working as a performer in Akihabara, Tokyo, she made her major debut in 2010, performing ending themes to the anime television series Highschool of the Dead. She released her debut album H.O.T.D. in September 2010, which features the ending themes from Highschool of the Dead. Her first two singles were used as ending themes to the anime television series A Certain Magical Index II.

Kurosaki's music is influenced by her love of anime and lolita fashion. Her songs have been featured in various anime series such as Jormungand, Tokyo Ravens, and The Fruit of Grisaia. She has collaborated with artists such as Mami Kawada, Kotoko, and Trustrick for her music releases. She performed twice at Anime Expo 2011 in Los Angeles, California, and is a regular performer at Japanese anime events such as LisAni, Animelo Summer Live, and Animax Musix. She has also appeared at Anime Festival Asia, Bangkok Comic Con, and CharaExpo. From 2011 to 2016, she was singer of the synthpop band [ALTIMA](https://anilist.co/staff/109511/), together with Motsu of the band Move.
TRUSTRICK was a musical duo composed of late [Sayaka Kanda](https://anilist.co/staff/112817/) and [Billy](https://anilist.co/staff/267009/Billy).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nk12) 

Writer of the script for Guilty Gear Xtra, the Guilty Gear novels and the drama CDs.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nk12) 

Writer of the script for Guilty Gear Xtra, the Guilty Gear novels and the drama CDs.
